Barbados: The Bridgetown Magazine explodes, 80 Percent of Bridgetown (800 homes), are razed in a great fire.
France: Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle: end of the War of Devolution. France obtains Lille and other territories of Flanders from Spain.
Philippine: Juan Manuel de la Peña Bonifaz appointed Governor-General (1668–1669).
Poland: Abdication of John II Casimir Vasa
Spain: The Treaty of Lisbon was signed. Spain recognized the sovereignty of Portugal's new ruling dynasty, the House of Braganza.
Sweden: Foundation of Sweden's central bank, Sveriges Riksbank
Taiwan: The Dutch abandon Keelung after alienating local aboriginal villages
